remarks: Axiom of Replacement (similar to Axiom Rep of [BellMachover] p. 463). The antecedent tells us ` ph ` is analogous to a "function" from ` x ` to ` y ` (although it is not really a function since it is a wff and not a class).  In the consequent we postulate the existence of a set ` z ` that corresponds to the "image" of ` ph ` restricted to some other set ` w ` .  The hypothesis says ` z ` must not be free in ` ph ` . (Contributed by NM, 26-Nov-1995.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Oct-2016.)
statement:
axrep5.1 $e |- F/ z ph $.
axrep5 $p |- ( A. x ( x e. w -> E. z A. y ( ph -> y = z ) ) -> E. z A. y ( y e. z <-> E. x ( x e. w /\ ph ) ) ) $.
$d w x y z $.
